question: "Does XP have a dashboard?"
answer:
XP does **not** have a web dashboard at this time.
However, once our work on XP6 is finished, XP will be controllable through a web dashboard.

question: "How can I reward users with XP?"
answer:
**Automated**
You can reward users with roles.
For this you can use Level Roles or Boosted Roles.
**Level Roles** are automatically assigned to the user as soon as he reaches a level.

**Boosted Roles** can be used to increase the xp rewards of certain users. Any user who has a boosted role will receive the correspondingly higher xp rewards.

You can find more information about that here:
```md
.xp help roles```
**Manually**
To manually give users xp, you can simply use one of these commands:
```md
.xp addxp <member> <xp>
.xp setxp <member> <xp>
.xp setlevel <member> <level>```

question: "Are XP's values editable?"
answer:
**Yes**! Values allow you to customize XP to your server and application.

Values, do not control functions, but the values that are distributed or used to make the functions work as they are supposed to.

For example, with the Values system we can set how much XP a member gets per message, how long cooldowns last between messages, how levels voice chat sessions are calculated, ...

**Customization**```md
> List all currently set values
.xp values> Set a value 
.xp value <value_name> <new_amount>```

question: "How do i change the state of a Module"
answer:
XP is divided into a few easy to understand modules to turn functions on or off.

e.g. the module "MessageXP" controls if members get XP by writing messages in the server, while the "Autonick" module controls if the levels of the users are displayed in their nicknames.\n\n**Customization**```md
> List the current modules and settings
.xp modules> Switch the setting of a module
.xp module <module>```

question: "How can i give or take XP to or from a Member?"
answer:
You can of course control your members' xp accounts manually.

For example, you can easily set the level of a user or add or remove someone's xp.

```md
.xp addxp <member> <xp>
.xp removexp <member> <xp>
.xp setxp <member> <xp>
.xp setlevel <member> <level>```

question: "Existiert Bielefeld?"
answer:
Ganz einfach. Nein.
Die Stadt Bielefeld existiert nicht. Sämtliche Hinweise auf ihre Existenz sind nur Teil und Werk der groß angelegten Bielefeldverschwörung.Die Existenz der Stadt Bielefeld wird der Bevölkerung vorgetäuscht, um an dieser Stelle etwas ganz anderes zu verbergen.Die Drahtzieher sind nur als „SIE“ bekannt und hinter „IHNEN“ stecken experten zuvolge die CIA, der Mossad und Außerirdische, die ihr Raumschiff als Universität getarnt haben.Wissenschaftler vermuten an der Stelle der vorgetäuschten Stadt sogar den Eingang nach Atlantis.Sämtliche Fotos aus Bielefeld wurden tatsächlich in anderen Städten aufgenommen und teilweise zu einem fiktiven Stadtbild montiert.
